intro: Orthosiphon varians, commonly known as the variable horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pale blue to violet in color. Orthosiphon varians is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
